## SDQ vs BIS-15

In the field of psychology and social science, comparing questionnaires like the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and Barratt Impulsiveness Scale 15 (BIS-15) can be a daunting task. This is where Harmony comes in. As a tool designed specifically for these kinds of tasks, Harmony can ease the process of harmonisation, making SDQ vs BIS-15 analysis significantly more efficient and accurate. Harnessing the power of large language models, Harmony facilitates the comparison of instruments like SDQ and BIS-15 by providing as detailed as a percentage match for each item in the two questionnaires. This meticulousness is unprecedented in standard manual comparisons, giving you a far superior insight into SDQ vs BIS-15. The software doesn't just stop at English versions. To cater to the global research community, Harmony has the capability to compare items in multiple languages, breaking the constraints of linguistic barriers. Harmony transforms the arduous procedure of tracing through lengthy PDFs and manually feeding data into Excel into a user-friendly process. For SDQ vs BIS-15 comparison, you can simply select the instruments from Harmony's database or, if you've got customized tools, drag them into Harmony's web interface. With Harmony, comparing SDQ vs BIS-15 is no longer a chore but an engaging and productive activity, improving the quality of your research and shedding light on your studies like never before.

## Compare the items in SDQ and BIS-15

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and BIS-15 into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just BIS-15 into Harmony</a> - compare BIS-15 with other instruments
